marklogic.body:
When I was the state Pres. for CA of the National Association for Fathers (NAF), we changed CA law to max cap alimony to equal 1/2 the length of the marriage to a max of 10 years. Â That was in the 1990's.
Perhaps MA should copy CA. Â I think its better (naturally I'm gonna brag about it). Â I don't believe in it all, which shocked the courts when I told them that in my last divorce. Â By that time I had become the National Pres. of the NAF. Â I wouldn't give, or take, a dime from anyone that I'm not enjoying the benefit of their company. Â That includes child support. Â As far as I'm concerned, when a divorce occurs, relative to children that are a product of the marriage, whomever has custody has the responsibility for raising those kids, as if the other party had died. Â That's what I told the court in my 1st divorce when I got custody. Â They tried to order her to pay me CS. Â I told them I would publicly Burn it, if they ordered and she complied. Â No way! Â The entire country would be better Off if that approach was followed, IMHO.
That's my perspective. Â Getting married is about the same as forming a corporation. Â Is a failed corporation liable in perpetuity to it's stockholders? Â NOT!
